Experience Office Coordinator Stanford University Engineering Research Administration June 2015  – Present (3 months) Stanford, CA - Served as the face of the department by helping guests in-person and over the phone 
- Processed PCards, travel reimbursements and other expense reimbursements  
- Managed hectic and complex calendars 
- Coordinated travel arrangements 
- Prepared prezi presentations for staff meetings Administrative Associate Stanford University Precourt Institute for Energy February 2015  –  July 2015  (6 months) Stanford, CA - Supported the program coordinator in the logistic planning of events, such as keeping track of attendees, creating name badges/tents, and preparing the agenda 
- Produced program booklets to display biographies and research interests of guest speakers and participants 
- Served as the lead contact for outreach meetings and responded to internal and external inquiries 
- Processed room requests for events and meetings 
 Health Services Specialist Planned Parenthood Mar Monte (PPMM) August 2014  –  February 2015  (7 months) San Jose, California - Handled administrative duties including scheduling appointments, maintaining medical records, and billing 
- Demonstrated proficiency in taking patient medical histories and vital signs, as well as in performing venipuncture and injections 
- Provided patient counseling including family planning, prenatal, and general medicine 
- Maintained patient’s confidentiality at all times per HIPAA guidelines 
- Ensured the cleanliness, sanitation and maintenance of all facilities, exam rooms and equipment 
 Development Assistant Planned Parenthood Mar Monte (PPMM) April 2014  –  July 2014  (4 months) San Jose, CA - Prepared and entered data to generate donor reports 
- Conducted donor/prospect research of individuals and foundations 
- Processed donations and acknowledged gifts in a timely manner 
- Maintained private and confidential information of patients and staff  
- Collaborated with development coordinator and director to plan special events and reach financial goals 
 Development Intern Planned Parenthood Mar Monte (PPMM) October 2013  –  February 2014  (5 months) - Assisted PPMM's development coordinator with two annual events, Peninsula Breakfast & c4 Spring Event, which raised over $400,000

Summary Administrative support professional offering versatile office management skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office programs. Strong planner and problem solver who readily adapts to change, works independently and exceeds expectations. Ability to “see the big picture” while maintaining attention to detail. Able to juggle multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines without compromising quality. Experience Office Coordinator Stanford University September 2013  – Present (2 years) Originate and verify transactions from procurement, reimbursement, and travel; ensuring that all required paperwork is attached, audit proof business purposes are used, and the funds are allocated properly. Journal transactions for reallocation, as required. Track travel expenses, as well as book reservations for departmental travel; notify travelers of what is required of them as well as ensure the expenses are accounted for, and allocated properly. Run multiple expense and time sensitive reports, verify transactions listed on the variance report for the department operating budget as well as the Dean’s Office operating budget. Edit pages on the ERA department website using Drupal. Set up numerous departmental and cross-departmental meetings, with and without catering. Custodian of department purchasing card. Assist Dean’s Office with journaling and procurement. Compile and enter data for the US News and World Report and for ASEE graduate school surveys.
